creditline: Lent by Richard and Diana Rose
description: black; desk-style phone with cradle for hand set; 2 circular indentations below either end of hand set on base; rotary dial with red numbers and black letters on white ground; smooth black cord
text: Taking its popular name from the two sculpted cup elements where the receiver rests, this transition "cradle" model represents a technological breakthrough as the bell was placed inside the body of the telephone rather than in a separate bell box.
title: "Ash Tray" model 925 rotary-dial telephone
